item.title: 'Alexander,' 'Kranks' Join Holiday Parade
item.description: LOS ANGELES (Hollywood Reporter) - "Alexander," Oliver Stone's ode to a Grecian warrior, rides into battle Wednesday, when the R-rated epic about the young conqueror will face a phalanx of films with broad family appeal, including the Thanksgiving holiday weekend's other newcomer, the Tim Allen comedy "Christmas With the Kranks."

item.title: Rumors on Rather's Successor Already Flying
item.description: NEW YORK (Hollywood Reporter) - Now the race begins.

item.title: Jailed Martha Stewart Offers Thanksgiving Message
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Incarcerated style guru Martha Stewart said on Tuesday she had a lot to be thankful for this Thanksgiving despite serving a five-month prison sentence for lying about a stock sale.

item.title: CBS Extends Lead in November Sweep
item.description: LOS ANGELES (Hollywood Reporter) - CBS tightened its grip on the November sweep lead with another decisive ratings win for the week of Nov. 15.

item.title: 'Alexander' -- Around the World in 94 Days
item.description: LOS ANGELES (Hollywood Reporter) - To film "Alexander," which opens nationwide Wednesday, director Oliver Stone took his cue from the biopic's subject, Alexander the Great, and set out to conquer several locations around the world.

item.title: Marc Almond Says He's Recovering Well from Bike Crash
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - British singer Marc Almond, who suffered severe head injuries in a motorcycle crash last month, says he is recovering well and that the "darker days of the ordeal" are hopefully behind him.

item.title: Zeffirelli to Become First Italian Knight
item.description: ROME (Reuters) - Franco Zeffirelli, the legendary filmmaker who has directed greats like Elizabeth Taylor and Placido Domingo, will be the first Italian to receive an honorary knighthood from Britain Wednesday.

item.title: Playwright Vs UK Censor: 200 Years of Strife
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - Never show Jesus Christ or Queen Victoria. Do not blaspheme or mention homosexuality.

item.title: Actor Must Pay $309,600 in Film Piracy Case
item.description: LOS ANGELES (Hollywood Reporter) - Warner Bros. has secured a $309,600 judgment against an actor for allegedly making promotional "screener" copies of "The Last Samurai" and "Mystic River" available for bootleg DVD copying and unauthorized Internet trading, the studio said Tuesday.

item.title: Ozzy and Sharon Plead for Return of Stolen Jewels
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - Rocker Ozzy Osbourne and his wife Sharon made a televised appeal to the British public on Tuesday for help in recovering jewelry worth nearly $2 million snatched from their English country estate.

item.title: Tom Hanks to Star in 'The Da Vinci Code' Movie
item.description: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Oscar-winning actor Tom Hanks has been cast to star in an upcoming movie adaptation of Dan Brown's best-selling mystery "The Da Vinci Code," film studio Columbia Pictures said on Tuesday.

item.title: Historic Game Show Winning Streak Comes to End
item.description: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - The longest winning streak in television game show history ended on Tuesday when "Jeopardy!" champion Ken Jennings lost after he collected more than $2.5 million in 74 victories.

item.title: Pavarotti to Retire After 40-City Tour
item.description: MODENA, Italy (Reuters) - Luciano Pavarotti, whose effortless tenor voice and powerful stage presence dominated opera for decades, plans to bow out like a superstar with a 40-city tour that will end with his retirement.

item.title: 'Campus' Life for Hines with Oxygen Series
item.description: NEW YORK (Hollywood Reporter) - Women's cable channel Oxygen has teamed up with "Curb Your Enthusiasm" star Cheryl Hines to develop a series featuring improvisational comedy.

item.title: 'Desperate' Death Drives ABC in Weekly Ratings
item.description: LOS ANGELES (Hollywood Reporter) - Another set of record-breaking numbers for freshman phenomenon "Desperate Housewives" fueled long-time laggard ABC to a close second-place finish in the coveted adults 18-49 demographic last week behind the network to beat this season, CBS.

item.title: Sundance Brings Out the Stars in Premiere Movies
item.description: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - The Sundance Film Festival on Tuesday named dozens of films featuring stars from Sandra Bullock to "007" Pierce Brosnan that will premiere in January at what has become the leading U.S. showplace for independent movies.

item.title: Indie Filmmakers Toast Wine-Tasting Comedy
item.description: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - A wine-soaked road comedy and a cocaine-fueled drama led the list of contenders on Tuesday for the Independent Spirit Awards, the American art-house world's version of the Oscars.

item.title: Former Nanny Sues Radio Host Don Imus for Comments
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Acerbic radio host Don Imus is being sued by his son's former nanny over an on-air outburst in which he called her a terrorist after firing her over an incident with a pocket knife and a paper-cap gun.

item.title: Princess Diana Hits Out at Charles in Videotape
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Princess Diana was "traumatized" by Prince Charles' refusal to publicly declare his love for her on the day of their engagement and became bulimic to punish herself for their failed marriage.

item.title: Kennedy Knickknacks to Go on the Block Next Year
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Lovers of Kennedy lore will get a rare chance at owning some common possessions of late President John F. Kennedy and his family in an auction of art, furniture and other effects from their homes.
